content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a simple implementation in Julia to extract Julia language code from markdown document. The function `extract_julia_code` will accept a string containing a markdown document and return all the Julia code blocks concatenated together with new lines.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    julia_blocks = filter(!isempty, split(md, "\n\n")) do block
        startswith(block, "```julia") || startswith(block, "```{julia}")
    end
    return join([join(split(block[10:end-4], "\n"), "\n") for block in julia_blocks], "\n\n")
end
```

This function works by splitting the input string into blocks separated by two newlines (`"\n\n"`). Then it filters out those blocks that start with either "```julia" or "```{julia}". These are the Julia code block markers in markdown. Finally, it joins all these code blocks together with a newline (`"\n"`) to create the final string.
